title: How to delete all your retweets - Quora

response.answer_text: If you want to delete all retweets in bulk then, you need to use one of the Twitter compliant Twitter management tools for your account safety. I recommend you Circleboom. It helps you to find specific tweets and delete them. You can delete retweets one by one or delete all retweets at once by using bulk (mass) delete option and save your time. You can also filter your retweets by username, date, languages, or any keywords before deleting. 4 easy step to delete your Retweets. Click the Get started button on the main webpage to delete all Retweets here. The tool will fetch your twitter data, you need to wait for a while. the waiting time depending on your account followers count. Click My Tweet menu and “Delete my Retweets” sub-menu Delete all retweets at once or use filter above the grid 5-) If you want to use more filter options then, you should use Delete Twitter Archive feature. This sub-menu fetch your all tweets, retweets, and replies and you can use different filter options.

Hi, you could use a Twitter marketing tool Tweet Attacks Pro to delete/unretweet all your retweets in one click, it can manage thousands of Twitter accounts simultaneously, you can schedule any Twitter tasks for this software to automate. Retweet and Unretweet Function ReTweet allows you to create unlimited ReTweet tasks to make your accounts looks active. The program can batch-ReTweet searched tweets based on your keywords, it can also watch for new tweets realtime and retweet them at once. You can select which accounts to retweet and how many tweets every account retweets. Unretweet task allows you to unretweet any retweeted tweet before automatically. The statistics are very clear, showing you the details and results of the tasks that are running.  Bind Proxy and Useragent If you have multiple accounts to run, just set every account to use a different proxy/useragent, you also can set every 2 or X accounts to use the same proxy/useragent. The program can also use the conventional proxy/useragent rotate method of using a different proxy/useragent every time the account logs in. It's very smart, it's all is down to your settings.
